decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Stifle, while controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes efficient card draw and selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler. With a mix of aggression, disruption, and card advantage, the deck looks to pressure the opponent while keeping them off balance and unable to execute their game plan effectively.

The core concept of this deck revolves around quickly getting creatures into the graveyard, either through self-mill or discard effects, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield with powerful reanimation spells. By utilizing cards like Entomb and Exhume alongside key creatures like Griselbrand and Necrotic Ooze, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats early in the game. The inclusion of disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Collective Brutality helps to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's resources while deploying threats quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Wasteland, Daze, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game and prevent the opponent from developing their own board. The creatures in the deck, such as Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, provide pressure and a clock for the opponent to deal with. Overall, the Grixis Aggro deck aims to be proactive in its game plan, quickly closing out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through powerful card draw and selection effects. With a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and value creatures, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The combination of disruption, card advantage, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor allows the deck to grind out wins in the late game while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently control the game using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, while utilizing reanimation spells such as Shallow Grave and Goryo's Vengeance to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand. The deck also features card draw and selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe, as well as ramp with Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal. By combining control elements with graveyard manipulation and powerful creature threats, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win quickly with high-impact creatures.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents while efficiently deploying threats to quickly close out the game. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Wasteland to slow down the opponent and Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice provide additional ways to pressure opponents and close out games efficiently. The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's plans and presenting a fast clock to win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token, which can quickly end the game. The deck includes a variety of cards to facilitate this combo, such as Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map. Additionally, the deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to disrupt opponent's strategies and protect the combo. The inclusion of cards like Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal allow for explosive plays and quick assembly of the combo.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt and control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Terminus and Council's Judgment, while generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to help close out the game. By managing the opponent's threats and resources, the deck aims to outlast and overpower the opponent in a game of attrition.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, supported by disruptive spells like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy. The deck also includes versatile threats like Gurmag Angler and True-Name Nemesis for late-game resilience. Efficient cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder help to smooth out draws, while Deathrite Shaman provides additional utility and disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's heavy blue and red requirements, while also enabling powerful plays with cards like Kolaghan's Command. The deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also relying on burn spells such as Chain Lightning and Lightning Bolt. The key strategy involves efficiently using resources like Fireblast and Price of Progress to finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a consistent stream of damage throughout the game, often overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana quickly through rituals and fast mana (Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond), then use cards like Dark Petition, Infernal Tutor, and Ad Nauseam to search for and cast Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one powerful turn. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress to handle opposing threats and protect the combo. The goal is to efficiently assemble the Storm combo and win the game before the opponent can effectively respond.

The main objective of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent using low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Stormchaser Mage, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to further pressure the opponent, and Price of Progress can punish opponents for playing nonbasic lands. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions using a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to further control the board. Additionally, it includes a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana access. The deck's strength lies in its ability to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and a stable mana base.

The focus of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana through spells like Dark Ritual and Rite of Flame, then use cards like Burning Wish and Infernal Tutor to search for and cast key combo pieces such as Ad Nauseam or Empty the Warrens. The deck includes disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan while the player executes their own combo. The goal is to win the game in a single explosive turn by chaining together spells and generating a large storm count.

The deck aims to control the game through a combination of disruptive spells and powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while deploying threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Umezawa's Jitte to gain advantage, the deck is able to dictate the pace of the game and come out ahead in the long run. The mana base is efficiently built to support the deck's game plan while also allowing for flexibility in casting spells of multiple colors.

The main focus of this Combo - Reanimator Legacy deck is to quickly discard big creatures into the graveyard, then reanimate them onto the battlefield for a powerful and explosive start. The deck utilizes cards like Faithless Looting, Exhume, and Reanimate to cheat big creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria into play early on. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality to control the opponent's hand and board state, allowing the reanimated creatures to dominate the game.
